body_html: Apologies, this was a false alarm. After posting, I noticed the /opt/tensorlibs which was an old directory where I used static libraries to get around a previous syntaxnet gcc linking error. I also had tensorflow 1.5 and tensorflow-gpu 1.4.1 both installed. I removed that /opt/tensorlibs directori, did a pip3 uninstall for both tensorflow and tensorflow-gup, and did a bazel clean. That solved the issue.

body: Apologies, this was a false alarm.  After posting, I noticed the /opt/tensorlibs which was an old directory where I used static libraries to get around a previous syntaxnet gcc linking error.  I also had tensorflow 1.5 and tensorflow-gpu 1.4.1 both installed.  I removed that /opt/tensorlibs directori, did a pip3 uninstall for both tensorflow and tensorflow-gup,  and did a bazel clean.  That solved the issue.
